definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Sometimes riders urge their horses on with whips.
sentences.chinese: 騎馬的人有時用鞭子策馬前進。

sentences.english: I left a sergeant in command and rode forward to reconnoitre.
sentences.chinese: 我留下一名中士指揮，自己策馬前去偵察敵情。

sentences.english: With that, the white knight rode off like a whirlwind.
sentences.chinese: 白武士說完，就策馬飛馳而去。

sentences.english: He ran hellos horse up the helloll.
He trotted his horse to the village.
sentences.chinese: 他策馬小跑來到那個村子。

sentences.english: Lisa was riding the horse, her long hair free floating in the air.
sentences.chinese: 策馬而來的正是麗莎，她的長髮飄散在空中。

sentences.english: He wheeled his horse about and galloped across the field.
sentences.chinese: 他撥轉馬頭，策馬馳過田野。

sentences.english: You ride to the nearest flower vendor and buy her a Black Rose.
sentences.chinese: 你策馬離開最近的花店買了一朵黑玫瑰給她。

sentences.english: He ran his horse up the hill。
A little faith brightens a rainy day, helping to chase tomorrow's sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 小小的信念照亮那下雨天，策馬長鞭追趕那明朝旭日。

sentences.english: Xuande thanked the man and rode on.
I enjoy galloping over the fields.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡在田野中策馬飛奔。

sentences.english: I spurred his horse and run away.
sentences.chinese: 我用踢馬刺策馬，跑開了。

sentences.english: He put his horse at the last jump and it went over successfully.
sentences.chinese: 他策馬跳躍最後一道障礙，馬成功地跳了過去。

sentences.english: Thirteen eagle on horseback to the old demons killing occupy the top of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 十三鷹策馬殺至老魔盤踞的華山之巔。

sentences.english: Better re-hitch the wagons, fellas, because there is work to be done!
sentences.chinese: 大傢伙最好重新策馬揚鞭，因爲還有工作有待完成。

definition: Qilian county in Haibei Tibetan autonomous prefecture 海北藏族自治州[Hai3 bei3 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Qinghai
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
to go on a hunting expedition
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
old place name (in Yan of Warring states, in modern Beijing city)
